TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are CARDINAL companies : ORG ( GPE ) , ORG ( GPE ) , and ORG ( GPE ) . They were represented before the ORG by PERSON ORG , a lawyer practising in GPE , PERSON , a lawyer practising in Tver , and PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON PERSON GPE , ORG to ORG .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . Afanasiy - Pivo ran a brewery in Tver . In DATE its chief executive officer Mr PERSON was charged with abusing his position by transferring the company ’s taxable profits to his other company , ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of GPE made a freezing order ( наложил арест ) against PERSON PERSON under LAW . The order concerned ORG shares owned by ORG , real estate and industrial equipment owned by ORG , ORG shares owned by ORG , and trademarks that Mr PERSON had allegedly criminally assigned to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant companies learned of the freezing order . They realised that domestic law , in particular LAW did not allow them to lodge an ordinary appeal against such an order .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE Mr PERSON applied for a supervisory review of the order . On DATE ORG returned his application as incomplete .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE Afanasiy - Pivo and ORG applied for a supervisory review . On DATE their application was dismissed on the merits .
CARDINAL . In DATE ORG lodged an ordinary appeal against the order . On DATE ORG terminated the proceedings ( прекратил производство ) as under LAW was not affected by the order .
CARDINAL . In DATE Afanasiy - Pivo applied for leave to appeal against the order out of time . On DATE the ORG of GPE refused .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the applicant companies CARDINAL times asked an investigator or prosecutor to unfreeze the assets , without success .
CARDINAL . The Code of Criminal Procedure DATE , as in force at the material time :

CARDINAL . A prosecutor ... or investigator ... may ask a court to freeze the assets of the suspect [ or ] the accused ... to secure them for meeting any award of damages , other recovery orders , or eventual forfeiture .
CARDINAL . NORP The asset freeze prohibits the owner or holder of the assets from disposing of and ... using them , and puts the assets into custody .
CARDINAL . Assets held by third parties may be frozen if there is reason to believe that they were gained by criminal activity of the suspect or accused .
CARDINAL . An appeal or appeal in cassation may be lodged by parties against ... court decisions that have not yet come into force ....
CARDINAL . The right of appeal lies with a convicted person , an acquitted person , their defenders or legal representatives , the public prosecutor , a victim or his representative .
